text.p: The following are the leading stories in the local press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Former president Kamuzu Banda was on Tuesday dropped from the ongoing 137 million kwacha fraud case because of old age and poor health. He is believed to be more than 90 years old.

- Customs Workers Union (CWU) which threatened to join the five week-old civil servants' strike on Tuesday, backed out after discovering the government had drawn contingency plans to ensure that border posts are operational.
- The High Court in Blantyre on Tuesday dropped the charge against former president Kamuzu Banda in the Kamuzu Academy fraud case in which he and three others are accused of criminal offences.

- Ailing former president Kamuzu Banda on Tuesday escaped from the fangs of prosecution in what Director of Public Prosecution Kamudoni Nyasulu described as "the master fraud case" due to his old age and ill health.
- Civil Servants trade unionist Thomas Mwafongo, who was tortured by police in Blantyre while under arrest for leading a demonstration last week, was on Tuesday acquitted by the Magistrates Court.
